publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6033 Kenny MacAskill: Double Jeopardy—That the Parliament agrees that, although double jeopardy must continue to provide an important safeguard, it needs to be reformed to fit with a fair and modern criminal justice system; agrees that persons who confess after an acquittal or who undermine trials by threats or corruption should be retried; supports reform to allow a second trial in very serious cases where important new evidence emerges and for this to apply retrospectively, and welcomes the Scottish Government’sconsultation on this issue. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*
